public NetworkAdapter()
               throws java.lang.Exception

      • NetworkAdapter

        public NetworkAdapter(java.util.List<Peripheral> peripherals)
        Initializes a NetworkAdapter to let the Executive software issue commands to the network.
        Parameters:
        peripherals - a List of registered Peripherals that can receive calls from remote peripherals. didReceivePacket(byte, byte[]) will pass packets on to peripherals from this list.

      • NetworkAdapter

        public NetworkAdapter(java.util.List<Peripheral> peripherals,
              java.lang.Object semaphoreObject)
        Initializes a NetworkAdapter to let the Executive software issue commands to the network.
        Parameters:
        peripherals - a List of registered Peripherals that can receive calls from remote peripherals. didReceivePacket(byte, byte[]) will pass packets on to peripherals from this list.
        semaphore - use this object to synchronize operations on peripherals

      • NetworkAdapter

        public NetworkAdapter(java.lang.String comPort,
              int bitrate,
              java.util.List<Peripheral> peripherals,
              java.lang.Object semaphoreObject)
        Initializes a NetworkAdapter to let the Executive software issue commands to the network.
        Parameters:
        comPort - the serial com port to use to communicate with the transceiver. this will vary if you are using *nix or windows.
        bitrate - the bitrate to use to communicate with the transceiver.
        peripherals - a List of registered Peripherals that can receive calls from remote peripherals. didReceivePacket(byte, byte[]) will pass packets on to peripherals from this list.
        semaphoreObject - use this object to synchronize operations on peripherals

    • Method Detail

      • getNetwork

        public Network getNetwork()

      • addNewDevice

        public int[] addNewDevice(int timeout)
                   throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Tells the network to start listening for new device and return the first new device to respond. Once this device has responded, tell the network to stop listening. If the timeout expires, the network will automatically stop listening and return null.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the number of seconds to wait before abandoning hope of establishing a connection. This method will block so be careful not to call this on your UI thread!!!
        Returns:
        a 2-element array of the form [ New Device ID, New Device Type ]. Return null if no device connected and the timeout occurred.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - lol Shawn I can't do everything for you n00b

      • removeDevice

        public boolean removeDevice(int id)
        Tells the network to remove a device. Successive calls to that peripheral will result in 'Device Not Responding' messages.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the peripheral to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the peripheral was successfully removed from the network.

      • didAddDevice

        public void didAddDevice(int id,
                int typeId)
        Description copied from interface: NetworkListener
        Called when a new device has been discovered and assigned an ID.
        Specified by:
        didAddDevice in interface NetworkListener
        Parameters:
        id - an integer representing the unique ID of this new peripheral in the network.
        typeId - an integer representing the type of this peripheral. That indicates which PeripheralDescriptor to use with it.

      • deviceNotResponding

        public void deviceNotResponding(int id)
        Description copied from interface: NetworkListener
        Called when the Network has determined that a peripheral has stopped responding to messages. This should notify the user in some way or take action to reconnect with the peripheral or disconnect with it altogether.
        Specified by:
        deviceNotResponding in interface NetworkListener
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the device that is not responding.

      • didReceivePacket

        public void didReceivePacket(byte deviceID,
                    byte[] data)
        Description copied from interface: NetworkListener
        Called when a new packet has been received from the network.
        Specified by:
        didReceivePacket in interface NetworkListener
        Parameters:
        deviceID - the ID of the peripheral that sent this packet
        data - The array of bytes that was received. This should be passed to a peripheral to be deciphered.
